subject: Horse Racing
lead_paragraph: A thoroughbred trainer suspended one year for violating horse medication rules received a temporary stay of his suspension while Kentucky racing officials considered his appeal. The trainer Patrick Biancone received the suspension last week from Kentucky racing stewards after a search of a refrigerator at his Keeneland barn found snake venom, which can be used to numb a horse’s nerves. Biancone said the substance did not belong to him. It was not immediately clear whether Biancone would be allowed to participate in the Breeders’ Cup this month at Monmouth Park.
